page.title: 02Community attitudes
page.content: People living in the Community enjoy their rural surroundings, and are very concerned with ecology and conservation. They guard their footpaths and Bridleways, which are properly marked and used. The weather and its effect on crops and farming is of major importance. Commuters, because of their gardens are also weather conscious, gardening being the main hobby of most residents. Communal activities include:- Women's Institute, Scouts, Cubs, Brownies, Guides, Gardening Guild and Venture Scouts. The meeting place for these activities is in the Village Hall which is in the adjoining survey block. Farming topics dominate conversation when groups meet with current affairs being of secondary importance.
